info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 8:06PM EDT until April 7 at 10:24AM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers...
Great Miami River at Taylorsville.
Great Miami River at Franklin.
Great Miami River at Miamisburg.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers...
Great Miami River at Troy.
Great Miami River at Sidney.
Great Miami River near Middletown.
Great Miami River at Miamitown.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Great Miami River at Troy.
* WHEN...Until late Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Flooding occurs along County Road 25A south of Troy and Tipp-Elizabeth Road near Tipp City. Additionally, property along the 1700 block of North County Road 25A also begins to flood, with East State Route 571 also flooded. Within the levee protected areas of of Troy...structures are protected to a stage of 20 feet.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.2 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/iln.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING
